If there's anyone thinking about trying it, don't. I was discussing with a guy on Instagram and he put it like this: mdma takes all your happiness for a month and crams it into 8 hours. I tried it when I was just about to turn 16, and it was pretty awful. Granted, I was an idiot and took a full pill outside in February in the UK all on my own and it didn't end too well. But that's not the main problem. The main problem is the fatigue, extreme paranoia and depression that follows in the weeks after. I couldn't sleep for hours and hours every night for at least a week. At night I was extremely paranoid, not like weed paranoia, but the fear that something beyond you is lurking just outside of your vision and you are in great danger. Cigarettes and alcohol had little effect of relieving this. All my muscles were exhausted for a few days. Don't try it

Not gonna lie, i really enjoy mdma. I started taking it in my younger years at raves dancing all night and loving everyone around me. Then i began to take it on a somewhat small night with a few friends. It was then that i discovered its’ full power. To be able to have substantially profound conversations with friends, to speak openly without caution and to listen without judgement or shame is an incredible feeling. Mdma being an empathogen helps me to learn and truly understand how another person views the world. It has opened my eyes, my head and my heart.
Taking once in a blue moon and with the right company, this drug has the potential to solve many conflicts and ptsd trauma.

The few times that I've tried, it was life altering. It allowed so much personal introspection, because I specifically went into the trip with emotional work in mind. Processing of grief, anxiety and trans-feminine associations that helped me feel who I really am, and comfortable in my body.
I wouldnt trade all my M experiences for the world but i am happy to have seratonin these days.

THERE IS NO REASON you should be taking more than 200mg of MDMA throughout a night. Beyond this, the roll will not be lengthened or intensified, all that will happen is that you strain the brain more, which inevitably leads to a worse comedown. For this very reason (and to make sure you don't lose the magic of rolling), make sure you have significant breaks between rolls. The general consensus is that you should wait at least 3 months in between each time you take MDMA, but if you wait 5 months or more it'll always feel like it's your first time rolling when you do it.
With that said, whilst it's not advisable to do it more than once every 3 months, in the large majority of cases it shouldn't be a problem if you break the rule once in a while, but keep in mind that MDMA can easily damage your natural serotonin production rates if done too often, which can lead to serotonin syndrome, meaning that you are literally unable to be happy.

My 2 cents advice.

Not necessary to use it at parties, if
1. You are quite a positive/sunny person.
2. You indeed like the music from the club, a true raver can rave sober. When I was rolling, i always cannot recall the music dj played, which is a pity if the dj is nice. By the end of the day, I still prefer to be pleased by the music rather than drugs.

If you still wanna give it a try,
1. Buy it from trust source, not some shady street dealers.
2. Measure your dose.
3. Drink water 500ml/hour to avoid dehydration and overhydration.
4. Bring chewing gum with you to ease jaw clenching.
5. As other said, use it with friends you 100% trust!!!
6. Don't abuse it. Use it at least 3 months intervals.

The main issue with this massive release of serotonin is that it releases so much of it that your natural production of serotonin is reduced which results in a halt in production for several days. This is when you get the ultimate crash from the MDMA wearing off and you can feel super depressed or demotivated. For people who already have issues with serotonin production (like people with anxiety or depression), this can be a major problem.

There was one study on rats that wasn't using MDMA, but MDA which is structurally similar and gives similar effects. However, MDA is known to give more of the psychedelic feel than MDMA. Using a study of MDA and concluding that MDMA has similar effects was one of the ways the DEA was able to place MDMA on Schedule 1.

Years later, they did a study with MDMA on rats. Administering 5 mg/kg of body weight, they found that most areas of the brain had no damage to seratonin receptors, save for the thalamus and hypothlamus where receptors had been reduced by 1/5th. There was no apparent functional or behavioral consequences.

After publishing these results, they went back to determine if at lower doses there was a point where there was no damage to any area of the brain. They found that point to be 2.5mg/kg of body weight. They administered that dose to rats once every two weeks and found no damage to nerve cells after four months.

Pure MDMA is fine. We do it about once a month, or so, no more than that though. It definitely affects me and my boyfriend differently. Not sure if it's because we're both different psychologically speaking or if it's the whole male vs female thing. Either way, the comedown is a lot harder for me if I take more of it, whilst he is fine with bigger dosages and won't have much of a comedown. I get EXTREMELY depressed for about a week after if I take more than 150mg. I'm not talking about "feeling kinda down today" depressed, I'm talking about "What is the point of life?I should just go and kill myself" kind of depressed. So, females beware. The high is better for us(or so I hear and have experienced), but the comedown can be very dangerous. Don't do MDMA unless you're in a safe space with people you trust. When people say "Do it at a rave", that is probably the worst advice I've ever heard. Specially for a first timer, taking it at a rave could be highly dangerous. Not only because it's full of people and loud music, but because if you get it in pill form, you're far more likely to get a shit ton of chemicals/toxins you don't want in there. Get MDMA at its pure form, which will be hard to find, but once you find it you're all set. Also keep in mind the purest you can probably find on the streets/market is 90%.
So yeah, make sure you're eating a healthy diet both prior and afterwards. This is VERY important. You should see MDMA as a 'happy points spender'. If you don't have enough happy points to spend or drain all of it, then you won't enjoy the experience as much and it can even turn dangerous. Make sure you got plenty of happy points to spend, and make sure you're putting more back in with a healthy diet and exercise. Exercise is also very important.

MDMA is a great drug when used correctly. It is NOT  a drug to be abused. You have to respect it more than you respect yourself. I've actually been through a long-term comedown from going over the top. I had only used it about 3 or 4 times over in a period of 3 years, never taking more than 0.2g in a night. However, on the most recent occasion I took 1g over 2 nights. The worst thing you could possibly do. My serotonin levels would've been completely depleted. 1g is a dangerous dose, you should never do more than 0.2-0.4g in a night. I was severely depressed for a month afterwards, and would regularly have brain zaps throughout the day(this is truly fucking horrible. It's like a literal shock to your brain which jolts you and makes you dizzy for a few seconds). I've since recovered, but I had genuinely thought I destroyed my life due to those 2 nights. Do not let 1 mistake ruin you. I've heard of people having permanent effects from overdosing and abusing MDMA by taking regularly.

TOTALLY inaccurate article. MDMA (3,4-methylenedioxy-methamphetamine) IS the original drug referred to as "Ecstasy." "Molly" is a slang term that has arisen in the last decade which commonly refers to a whole family of synthetic methcathinone drugs which can include any of the following and more: Methylone, Ethylone, MDPV, 4-MEC, 4-MMC, Pentedrone and MePP (also commonly sold as "Bath Salts" drugs). Many of these have an "MDMA-like effect" but none are MDMA "Ecstasy." "Molly" is also now being used as a slang term for "Ecstasy," however, over 85% of the substances being sold as "Molly" contain one of these synthetic methcathinones and no MDMA whatsoever. People consuming "Molly" can be taking ANY of these substances, ALL of which are trafficked under the name "Molly." The article also states, "MDMA can be mixed with caffeine to make Ecstasy." Uh, no. WTF?? Who did the research for this article? If you mix MDMA (already "Ecstasy") with caffeine you will get (wait for it....), MDMA cut with caffeine. There is no chemical reaction or new drug created. This response was written by someone who dissasembles clandestine laboratories for a living (Meth, MDMA, DMT, LSD, etc). "Journalism" like this, on the other hand, gets people hurt. You need to take this down. Incredibly irresponsible and bad misinformation no matter what your "drug politics" is. - Timothy Hedrick

This is a pretty simplistic explanation of the effects of MDMA and gives the incorrect impression that most "molly" is still sold as "ecstasy" pills. "Molly" almost always refers to pure MDMA, and it is not usually a pill but loose powder or rocked powder. Ecstasy refers to MDMA that has been put into a pill along with a variety of different other drugs such as caffeine, amphetamine, and/or heroin. That's a pretty significant difference that should've been clarified.

MDMA's dopaminergic effects are quite important in terms of the drugs addictive nature and its subjective effects. The video gives the false impression that serotonin is the only important neurotransmitter regarding MDMA and that's just lazy.

Humans and other living beings have been altering their consciousness with various substances from the dawn of time.

It's very rare to find people whose intake consists only of food and water. Food on its own can release high amounts of hormones in your brain, that's one of the reasons why so many are addicted to eating. Not to mention thousands of different legal drugs freely available for everyone.

The grim fact is, that whether you like it or not, you have to put stuff in your body to live, and the stuff will always have various effects on your health and psyche.

That being said, I'm obviously not making an argument that everything is on the same scale in terms of potency and hazards. The differences are vast, and illegal drugs can be especially dangerous and even deadly. But as absurd it may sound, if abused, food and water can be deadly as well.

The point is, that it's just not that simple that certain substances are pure evil with no positive effects. Effects will always be various, and the properties of the resulting outcome will always be debatable.

This is how legal drugs work too. You get medicine for hair loss, but its side effects may include gynecomastia. It all boils down to which of these options you prefer: Being bald, or having luscious hair and man boobs. Both options have their perks, but in the end taking or refusing to take the medicine is always up to personal preference.

Just like drugs, computer games, movies, music and books can be very powerful forms of escapism. You have experiences that aren't "real", so to speak, but enjoy them to the extent that your brain releases hormones that make you feel happy. Whether it's happening because of an external substance or a strong form of self suggestion (for example intense video game experience) is quite irrelevant.

I enjoy playing computer games, but I also enjoy getting fucked up from time to time. Hell, I even enjoy playing games when I'm fucked up. I'm not trying to romanticize substance abuse nor video games, but I can honestly say that altering your consciousness in a way or another can also be a blessing which makes you appreciate the "unaltered reality" even more than you did before.

tips&tricks when using MDMA:

1. Do not take it alone, be with a group of friends with at least one experienced user. (have them now you took it)
2. If you are scarred do not take it. You have to be fully willing to take it.
3. Stay hydrated (drink water) BUT don't drink to much water.
4. When you are feeling lightheaded/sweating a lot. Take cold/not hot water and make your forehead, neck and polses wet.
5. Use a chewing gum while on MDMA.
6. do not use it every week try keeping it to one time every one or two months.
7. Make sure you buy a safe product. (example. a red pill with a +/-) The advanced user of your group will probably now more about this.
8. The next morning or days after usages you will feel "depressed".
9. If it is your first time do not take more than one pill. 
10. Take it on music you like to listen to for a greater effect.
